title: Synthetic Recap
body:
ORLANDO – On a night where offensive execution proved elusive for nearly everyone, one man authored a historic masterpiece. Rony Seikaly didn’t just will the Orlando Magic to a 94-90 victory over the Milwaukee Bucks; he delivered a performance for the ages, carrying his team with a superhuman individual effort.

The game was a defensive grind, with both teams struggling to find a consistent rhythm. The Bucks’ offense sputtered, shooting a frigid 37% from the field. While Ray Allen managed 21 points, he did so on an inefficient 6-of-18 shooting. Glenn Robinson added 17, but the night belonged to the man in the paint for Orlando.

Seikaly was an unstoppable force, a study in relentless dominance. He poured in a colossal 42 points, a figure that dwarfed the output of every other player on the court. His work was not done there; he completely controlled the glass, hauling in a game-high 19 rebounds to complete a breathtaking double-double. Every Magic possession seemed to funnel through him, and the Bucks had no answer for his combination of power and finesse in the post.

His heroics were the sole reason Orlando weathered a late Milwaukee charge. While Penny Hardaway had a quiet night with only 7 points, his 11 assists were often dishes to the unstoppable Seikaly. The Magic needed every one of Seikaly’s points and rebounds to secure the hard-fought win.

In a season of team narratives, this was an unforgettable night of individual brilliance. Rony Seikaly didn’t just win a game; he etched his name into the record books with a legendary 42-point, 19-rebound tour de force that left an entire arena in awe.
